channel.title: Software Development on Katie Huang
channel.description: Recent content in Software Development on Katie Huang

item.title: Password Generator üîë
item.description: Overview A password generator aimed at creating complex passwords that are easy to remember using user’s input. Motivation Often when I create my own passwords, I like to use short songs or phrases to generate my passwords by replacing letter with symbols that resemble each letter. This makes it easier to remember in my mind than using software to randomly generate passwords. How It Works Simply type in the text that you want to use to generate your password and click the “Generate Password” button.

item.title: PubMed Abstract Analyzer üßê
item.description: PubMed Article Entity Annotator This program takes the abstract of a PubMed article ID (PMID) as a command line argument and saves the annotations of recognized entities (e.g. proteins, drugs, diseases) as a JSON file. It does this by performing the following steps: Ask the user to type in the PMID of interest Uses the PubMed web service to retreive the PubMed article for that PMID Extracts the abstract from the PubMed article Uses Gilda, an entity recognition web service, to annotate the abstract with recognized entities It contains the following files:
